thread.title: Unique carousel featuring giant fish figures coming to The Battery in Lower Manhattan
thread.title_full: Unique carousel featuring giant fish figures coming to The Battery in Lower Manhattan - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Associated Press
title: Unique carousel featuring giant fish figures coming to The Battery in Lower Manhattan
text:
NEW YORK, N.Y. - A unique carousel is coming to a waterfront park in Lower Manhattan.
The SeaGlass Carousel is slated to open at The Battery on Aug. 20. It's a giant nautilus shell featuring 30 monumental fish figures. A new Tiffany & Co. Foundation Woodland Gardens will surround the carousel.
The not-for-profit Battery Conservancy says the carousel was designed to recall The Battery's history as the original home of the New York Aquarium.
The design allows visitors to "sit within" the luminescent fish figures instead of riding them as one would a typical carousel.
The carousel and gardens are part of a major revitalization of the 25-acre public park that includes new pedestrian and bike paths, perennial gardens and restrooms. The work is nearing completion.
About 6 million people visit the park annually.
